snippet: In a scathing ruling, the judge said the process of denying broad distribution of the drug has been “corrupted by political interference” for years.
abstract: Federal Judge Edward R Korman steps up his criticism of Obama administration, accusing Justice Dept of making 'frivolous' arguments in its attempt to delay making morning-after emergency contraceptive pill available to women and girls of all ages without prescription.
lead_paragraph: In a scathing ruling, the judge said the process of denying broad distribution of the drug has been “corrupted by political interference” for years.

headline.main: Judge Refuses to Drop His Order Allowing Morning-After Pill for All Ages
headline.print_headline: Judge Refuses to Drop His Order Allowing Morning-After Pill for All Ages
